subject: College Athletics
lead_paragraph: Iowa won three semifinal matches in St. Louis and clinched its first N.C.A.A. wrestling title since 2000. The Hawkeyes’ exceptional depth piled up 102 points, ensuring the university’s 21st overall title with a day still left in the tournament. Ohio State (71) was a distant second, followed by Iowa State (68), Penn State (63), Central Michigan (61.5), Michigan (61), Nebraska and Oklahoma State (58), Cornell (57.5) and Minnesota (56.5).
